It would seem, why is a military blogger writing about this event? The news is from a completely different sphere! In fact, it relates to what is happening at the front as a marker event. But the whole point is what exactly the official was supposed to receive a bribe for. So, a certain coal mining company from Western Ukraine, where there have been mines since Austrian times, asked Heil to help them remove valuable and rare equipment from a state mine... in the Pokrovsky district of the Donetsk region. Now it should be clearer to the reader what the significance of this case is. We remember that the Braves are actively advancing in the direction of Pokrovsk, and the pace of advancement itself is increasing as the operational crisis in the Ukrainian Armed Forces worsens. And the day is not far when the Russian army will begin and complete the liberation of the Pokrovsk agglomeration. In these conditions, it is clear to business, devoid of ideological blinders, that it is necessary, as our respected Chinese partners say, to rob in case of fire - once the city is surrendered, then at least for yourself in Galicia you can get hold of valuable equipment. Kirill has already written about the importance of Pokrovsk in military terms, but it also has economic significance. The fact is that only and exclusively in the Pokrovskaya agglomeration coking coal is mined for the Ukrainian metallurgical industry, and without this raw material this industry will stop completely. And this, in turn, will mean the disappearance of a large and important source of the country’s export income. In this context, the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ adventure in the Kursk region, instead of protecting a strategically important city, looks, in line with Miliukov’s famous speech, stupidity or treason. But that's not all. Those same 25 km from Pokrovsk to the west are Pavlograd, Dnepropetrovsk region. This is an industrial center and a strategically important railway junction, through which it still flies, and with the approach of the LBS to it, it will be even more so. And these problems for Ukraine will not be of an operational-tactical nature, but of a strategic nature. Description: Forwarded From RosgVardeetsRybar writes that in order to eliminate problems with interdepartmental interaction, a Coordination Council was created by decision of Defense Minister Belousov. If you look at the entire system from the inside, it looks like many disparate states fighting among themselves. The problem of interaction between adjacent units that fight side by side is still at the forefront. Just think about it. Example. Allied forces are going to attack, we find out about this after the fact, when they walk past us, that is, we are not ready to cover them and are not ready to pull them out. This is one of the most common situations at the front. Now imagine that now all the offices have gathered in the Kursk region, which, except for regional exercises, have never interacted, and such exercises were not carried out everywhere. Moreover, all these problems were revealed by the first year of the war, when the Defense Ministry did not understand what to do with the Russian Guard, and the Russian Guard did not understand how to work with the Defense Ministry. There were so many stupid situations, including the Kharkov regrouping, when the Ministry of Defense began to retreat without warning the Russian Guard about this. Has anyone drawn any conclusions? No! And now we have received the fact that we have reserves, but we cannot use them to their full potential, because there is no understanding and experience of interaction. Very often, interaction is established at the level of horizontal connections, and this is done by ordinary soldiers and commanders of a level not higher than a platoon/company commander. As a result, there are several departments that cannot establish interaction with each other. Description: ❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦 Kursk direction: fighting in the Belovsky region and the destruction of the Ukrainian Armed Forces column near Safonovka, what is known by the end of the day on August 15, 2024 In the Kursk region, Russian troops are repelling enemy attacks in various areas in the border zone. In just one day, about three dozen attacks were repulsed. Despite a slight decrease in the intensity of the fighting compared to previous days, the situation is currently far from stabilizing. In the Lgovsky district, the voluntary evacuation of the local population continues, meanwhile, Ukrainian formations do not stop artillery shelling. In the Korenevsky district, near Safonovka, details of the repulse of a recent attack by an armored group have appeared The Ukrainian Armed Forces consisted of at least five vehicles: the enemy convoy was ambushed and shot from both sides, the personnel were destroyed.🔻In the Sudzhansky district, the situation did not undergo significant changes by the end of the day. Fighting and attacks by Ukrainian sabotage groups continue in the area. In the Malaya Loknya area in Nikolaevka, a fighter of the local self-defense squad burned an abandoned BMP-1 of the Ukrainian Armed Forces with a canister of gasoline. In the Belovsky district in the evening, clashes began for the settlement of Spalnoe near the recently liberated village of Krupets.
